content: The NBC News article reports that the RESTRICT Act has been endorsed by the White House and introduced by a bipartisan group of senators to allow the federal government to regulate and ban foreign-produced technology, including TikTok. The Act provides the Secretary of Commerce with broad powers to regulate technology produced in six countries with adversarial relationships with the US, including China, and applies to technology that could present national security risks or be used to interfere in elections. The Act's implications go beyond TikTok, and it is designed to pre-empt situations in which technology produced in the six authoritarian countries named in the bill becomes popular in the US. The article also notes that the lack of data privacy laws in the US makes TikTok just a small part of the problem regarding the collection and abuse of Americans' data.
